storyTitle: As Attendance Manager, I want to generate attendance reports combining biometric and manual data to achieve comprehensive attendance insights

testCases.title: Validate generation of attendance report with combined data
preconditions: Manager has valid credentials with Attendance Manager role
Manager is logged into the system
Biometric attendance data exists in the database for the selected period
Manual attendance data exists in the database for the selected period
Reporting module is accessible and functional
At least one attendance anomaly exists in the data (absence or late arrival)

steps.action: Navigate to the reporting module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Reporting module page loads successfully with report type options and filter controls visible

steps.action: Select report type as 'Daily Attendance Report' from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Report type is selected and additional filter options become available

steps.action: Apply filters: Select specific department, date range (last 7 days), and employee group
steps.expectedResult: Filters are applied successfully, filter tags are displayed showing selected criteria

steps.action: Click on 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request, loading indicator appears, and report generation completes within 5 seconds

steps.action: Review the generated report on screen
steps.expectedResult: Report displays with combined biometric and manual attendance data including employee names, check-in/check-out times, attendance status, and data source indicators

steps.action: Verify the report summary section
steps.expectedResult: Summary shows total employees, present count, absent count, late arrivals, and early departures with accurate calculations

steps.action: Scroll through the detailed attendance records section
steps.expectedResult: All attendance records are displayed with clear distinction between biometric entries (marked with biometric icon) and manual entries (marked with manual icon)

steps.action: Locate and review highlighted anomalies in the report
steps.expectedResult: Attendance anomalies such as absences and late arrivals are highlighted in red or with warning icons, making them easily identifiable

steps.action: Verify data accuracy by cross-checking sample records with source data
steps.expectedResult: Report data matches the source biometric and manual attendance records with 100% accuracy

postconditions: Report remains displayed on screen for further actions
Report data is temporarily cached for export operations
System logs the report generation activity with timestamp and user details
Manager remains logged in and can generate additional reports

testCases.title: Verify report export functionality
preconditions: Manager has valid credentials with Attendance Manager role
Manager is logged into the system
Attendance data exists in the database for the selected period
Reporting module is accessible
Browser has download permissions enabled
Sufficient storage space available on local machine

steps.action: Navigate to the reporting module and select 'Weekly Attendance Report' type
steps.expectedResult: Report type selection is successful and filter options are displayed

steps.action: Apply filters: Select date range for current week and specific department
steps.expectedResult: Filters are applied and displayed correctly

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated within 5 seconds and displayed on screen with all attendance data visible

steps.action: Verify the report is fully loaded and displays complete data
steps.expectedResult: Report shows summary statistics, detailed records, and highlighted anomalies without any loading errors

steps.action: Click on 'Export' button and select 'CSV' format from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears with CSV format selected, file name suggestion is displayed

steps.action: Confirm the CSV export by clicking 'Download' button
steps.expectedResult: CSV file download initiates immediately, download progress is shown, and file is saved to default download location

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file using spreadsheet application
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully with proper column headers, all attendance data is present, data is properly formatted in columns, and special characters are correctly encoded

steps.action: Verify CSV data accuracy by comparing with on-screen report
steps.expectedResult: CSV file contains identical data to the displayed report including all records, summary statistics, and anomaly indicators

steps.action: Return to the report screen and click 'Export' button, then select 'PDF' format
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears with PDF format selected and file name suggestion is displayed

steps.action: Confirm the PDF export by clicking 'Download' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file download initiates immediately, download completes successfully, and file is saved to default download location

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using PDF reader application
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully with professional formatting, company header/logo, report title, filter criteria, summary section, and detailed attendance table with proper pagination

steps.action: Verify PDF formatting and data completeness
steps.expectedResult: PDF displays all data with proper alignment, highlighted anomalies are visible in color or bold, page numbers are present, and data matches the on-screen report exactly

postconditions: CSV and PDF files are successfully downloaded to local machine
Downloaded files contain accurate and complete attendance data
System logs the export activities with timestamps and file formats
Original report remains displayed on screen
Manager can perform additional export operations if needed

testCases.title: Ensure access control for attendance reports
preconditions: System has role-based access control configured
Test user account exists without Attendance Manager role (e.g., regular employee role)
Valid Attendance Manager account exists in the system
Attendance data exists in the database
Reporting module is functional and accessible to authorized users

steps.action: Log into the system using unauthorized user credentials (regular employee account)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs into the system and is redirected to their role-appropriate dashboard

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the reporting module by entering the URL directly or clicking on reports menu (if visible)
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays 'Access Denied' or '403 Forbidden' message stating 'You do not have permission to access attendance reports'

steps.action: Verify that reporting module link is not visible in the navigation menu for unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: Reporting module option is hidden or grayed out in the navigation menu for users without appropriate permissions

steps.action: Attempt to access report generation API endpoint directly using browser developer tools or API client
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Log out from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to login page

steps.action: Log into the system using authorized Attendance Manager credentials
steps.expectedResult: Manager successfully logs in and is redirected to the dashboard with reporting module visible in navigation

steps.action: Navigate to the reporting module by clicking on the reports menu option
steps.expectedResult: Reporting module page loads successfully with all report types, filters, and controls accessible

steps.action: Select 'Monthly Attendance Report' type and apply filters for current month and all departments
steps.expectedResult: Report type and filters are applied successfully without any access restrictions

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated successfully within 5 seconds and displays complete attendance data with summary and details

steps.action: Click 'Export' button and select CSV format
steps.expectedResult: Export functionality is accessible and CSV file downloads successfully with correct data

steps.action: Return to report screen and export the same report as PDF
steps.expectedResult: PDF export completes successfully with proper formatting and complete data

steps.action: Verify all report operations complete without any errors or access restrictions
steps.expectedResult: All operations (generation, viewing, exporting) succeed without errors, and system logs show successful activities

postconditions: Unauthorized user access attempt is logged in security audit trail
Authorized manager successfully accessed and used all reporting features
Report generation and export activities are logged with manager's user ID
System maintains security integrity with proper access control enforcement
No unauthorized data access occurred during the test

storyTitle: As Attendance Manager, I want to receive alerts for attendance anomalies to achieve timely intervention

testCases.title: Validate detection and alerting of attendance anomalies
preconditions: Manager has valid credentials with Attendance Manager role
Manager is logged into the system
Anomaly detection rules are configured (absence, late arrival thresholds)
Manager's email address is configured in the system
System notification service is active and functional
Email service is configured and operational
Real-time attendance monitoring is enabled

steps.action: Simulate an attendance anomaly by creating an absence record for an employee who was scheduled to work
steps.expectedResult: Absence record is created in the attendance database with current timestamp

steps.action: Wait for the system to process the attendance data and detect the anomaly
steps.expectedResult: System's real-time monitoring service detects the absence anomaly within 1 minute based on predefined rules

steps.action: Verify that an alert notification is generated in the system
steps.expectedResult: Alert is created in the alerts database with details including employee name, anomaly type (absence), timestamp, and status (pending acknowledgment)

steps.action: Check the manager's email inbox for alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Email alert is received within 1 minute containing subject line 'Attendance Anomaly Alert', employee details, anomaly type, date/time, and link to view in system

steps.action: Check the system notifications panel in the manager's dashboard
steps.expectedResult: System notification appears in the notifications panel with red badge indicator, showing alert summary and timestamp

steps.action: Click on the system notification to view alert details
steps.expectedResult: Alert detail modal opens displaying complete information: employee name, department, anomaly type, detection time, attendance record details, and 'Acknowledge' button

steps.action: Review the alert details for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All alert information matches the simulated absence anomaly including correct employee, date, time, and anomaly classification

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' button in the alert detail modal
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment confirmation dialog appears asking for optional comments

steps.action: Enter acknowledgment comment 'Reviewed and will follow up with employee' and confirm
steps.expectedResult: Alert status updates to 'Acknowledged', acknowledgment timestamp is recorded, manager's user ID is logged, and comment is saved

steps.action: Navigate to the alerts history page
steps.expectedResult: Alerts history page displays the acknowledged alert with status 'Acknowledged', acknowledgment time, acknowledging manager name, and comment

steps.action: Verify the alert log entry in the system
steps.expectedResult: Alert log contains complete audit trail: creation timestamp, detection time, notification sent time, acknowledgment time, manager ID, and all status changes

postconditions: Alert is successfully acknowledged and status updated in database
Complete audit trail exists for the alert lifecycle
Email notification was delivered successfully
System notification was displayed and acknowledged
Alert remains in history for future reference
Manager can view alert details from history at any time

testCases.title: Verify alert access control
preconditions: System has role-based access control configured for alerts
Test user account exists without alert access permissions (regular employee role)
Valid Attendance Manager account exists with alert access
At least one active alert exists in the system
Alert module is functional and accessible to authorized users

steps.action: Log into the system using unauthorized user credentials (regular employee account)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs into the system and is redirected to their role-appropriate dashboard

steps.action: Check if alerts or notifications panel is visible in the unauthorized user's dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Alerts panel is either not visible or shows only user's personal notifications, not attendance anomaly alerts

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the alerts module by entering the URL directly in browser
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays 'Access Denied' message stating 'You do not have permission to view attendance alerts'

steps.action: Attempt to access alerts API endpoint directly using browser developer tools
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message 'Insufficient permissions to access alerts'

steps.action: Verify that no attendance alert emails were sent to unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized user's email inbox does not contain any attendance anomaly alert emails

steps.action: Log out from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to login page

steps.action: Log into the system using authorized Attendance Manager credentials
steps.expectedResult: Manager successfully logs in and dashboard loads with alerts panel visible showing notification badge with alert count

steps.action: Click on the alerts/notifications icon in the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Alerts panel expands showing list of active attendance anomaly alerts with details: employee name, anomaly type, time, and status

steps.action: Verify that all alerts are accessible and actionable
steps.expectedResult: Manager can view all alert details, filter alerts by type/status, and access acknowledgment functionality

steps.action: Select an unacknowledged alert from the list
steps.expectedResult: Alert detail view opens showing complete information with 'Acknowledge' button enabled

steps.action: Click 'Acknowledge' button and add comment 'Investigating the issue'
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment is processed successfully, alert status changes to 'Acknowledged', and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the acknowledgment is recorded in the system
steps.expectedResult: Alert shows 'Acknowledged' status with manager's name, acknowledgment timestamp, and comment visible in alert history

postconditions: Unauthorized access attempts are logged in security audit trail
Authorized manager successfully accessed and managed alerts
Alert acknowledgment is recorded with complete audit information
System maintains security integrity with proper access control
No unauthorized alert access occurred during the test

testCases.title: Ensure alert delivery latency within SLA
preconditions: Manager has valid credentials with Attendance Manager role
Manager is logged into the system
Anomaly detection rules are configured and active
Manager's email address is configured correctly
System notification service is running
Email service is operational with no delays
Real-time monitoring is enabled
System clock is synchronized with accurate time source

steps.action: Note the current system time before triggering the anomaly
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded as baseline (T0) for latency measurement

steps.action: Trigger an attendance anomaly event by creating a late arrival record (employee check-in 30 minutes after scheduled time)
steps.expectedResult: Late arrival record is created in the attendance database with exact timestamp (T1)

steps.action: Monitor the system's anomaly detection process in real-time
steps.expectedResult: System's monitoring service picks up the new attendance record and begins anomaly evaluation

steps.action: Wait and observe when the alert is generated in the alerts database
steps.expectedResult: Alert is generated and recorded in the database with creation timestamp (T2), where T2 - T1 is less than 60 seconds

steps.action: Check the manager's email inbox and note the time when alert email is received
steps.expectedResult: Alert email is received with timestamp (T3), where T3 - T1 is less than or equal to 60 seconds, meeting the 1-minute SLA

steps.action: Verify the email content includes accurate timestamp information
steps.expectedResult: Email displays anomaly detection time, employee check-in time, scheduled time, and delay duration (30 minutes late)

steps.action: Check the system notifications panel for the alert
steps.expectedResult: System notification appears with timestamp (T4), where T4 - T1 is less than or equal to 60 seconds

steps.action: Click on the system notification to view alert details
steps.expectedResult: Alert detail opens showing late arrival anomaly with employee name, scheduled time, actual check-in time, and delay calculation

steps.action: Navigate to the alerts log/history section
steps.expectedResult: Alerts log page displays the new alert entry with complete timestamp trail

steps.action: Verify the alert log entry contains all required timestamps
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows: anomaly occurrence time (T1), alert generation time (T2), email sent time (T3), notification displayed time (T4), and all timestamps are within 1-minute window from T1

steps.action: Calculate and verify the total latency from anomaly occurrence to alert delivery
steps.expectedResult: Total latency (T3 - T1 or T4 - T1) is less than or equal to 60 seconds, confirming SLA compliance

steps.action: Review system performance logs for alert processing time
steps.expectedResult: Performance logs confirm alert generation and delivery completed within the 1-minute SLA requirement with no errors or delays

postconditions: Alert was delivered within the 1-minute SLA requirement
Complete timestamp audit trail exists in the system logs
Email and system notifications were delivered successfully
Alert remains in the system for manager acknowledgment
Performance metrics are logged for SLA monitoring
System continues to monitor for additional anomalies
